filmography.title: The Public Enemy
filmography.role_description: A vicious young gangster who rises through the ranks of the Prohibition-era underworld, infamous for the scene where he smashes a grapefruit into his girlfriend's face.
filmography.plot: A young hoodlum rises up the ranks of the Chicago underworld, but his life of crime eventually leads to tragedy.

filmography.title: Taxi!
filmography.role_description: A feisty, independent cab driver who leads a war against a corrupt taxi syndicate that is using violent tactics to monopolize the business.
filmography.plot: A diverse group of independent cab drivers must stand together to fight off a ruthless syndicate trying to muscle in on their territory.

filmography.title: Footlight Parade
filmography.role_description: A high-energy producer of stage prologues for movie theaters who fights to keep his business afloat and outdo his rivals with spectacular musical numbers.
filmography.plot: A Broadway director turns to producing live musical prologues for movie theaters, facing pressure to create three spectacular numbers in a short time.

filmography.title: Lady Killer
filmography.role_description: A con man who flees to Hollywood to escape the mob, becomes a famous movie star, and then has to deal with his old gang when they track him down.
filmography.plot: A movie theater usher is fired and becomes a con man, eventually fleeing to Hollywood where he inadvertently becomes a star.

filmography.title: Picture Snatcher
filmography.role_description: An ex-con who decides to go straight by becoming a photographer for a sleazy tabloid, using his street smarts to get sensational photos.
filmography.plot: A former gangster leaves prison and tries to go legitimate by taking a job as a photographer for a sensationalist tabloid newspaper.

filmography.title: G Men
filmography.role_description: A tough, street-wise lawyer who joins the Department of Justice as a federal agent to avenge the death of his friend at the hands of mobsters.
filmography.plot: A lawyer abandons his practice to join the G-Men (government men) and hunt down the gang that killed his friend.

filmography.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
filmography.role_description: The boastful weaver who is transformed into a donkey by the mischievous fairy Puck in Shakespeare's classic comedy.
filmography.plot: Shakespeare's comedy about four young Athenian lovers and a group of amateur actors who are manipulated by fairies in a magical forest.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Cinematography; Oscar: Win – Best Editing

filmography.title: Ceiling Zero
filmography.role_description: A reckless, womanizing airmail pilot whose irresponsible behavior leads to tragedy for his fellow aviators.
filmography.plot: The professional and personal lives of pilots at a commercial airline are complicated by bad weather, dangerous flights, and a reckless ace pilot.

filmography.title: Angels with Dirty Faces
filmography.role_description: A notorious gangster who becomes an idol to a group of street kids, eventually making a sacrificial gesture to prevent them from following in his footsteps.
filmography.plot: A gangster is treated like a hero by the local boys, but his childhood friend, now a priest, wants to save them from a life of crime.

filmography.title: The Oklahoma Kid
filmography.role_description: A charismatic outlaw who seeks revenge against the man who framed his father and took over the town.
filmography.plot: In the Oklahoma Territory, a cowboy outlaw seeks justice against a gang of claim jumpers who have framed his father for murder.

filmography.title: Each Dawn I Die
filmography.role_description: An innocent reporter framed for manslaughter who is sent to a brutal prison, where he befriends a hardened gangster and becomes bitter and vengeful.
filmography.plot: A reporter is framed for a crime he didn't commit and sent to prison, where he slowly becomes a hardened criminal while trying to prove his innocence.

filmography.title: The Roaring Twenties
filmography.role_description: A World War I veteran who returns home to find no work and inadvertently becomes a powerful bootlegger during Prohibition.
filmography.plot: Three men meet in a foxhole during World War I and face different destinies when they return home to Prohibition-era America.

filmography.title: Torrid Zone
filmography.role_description: A tough foreman on a banana plantation in Central America who deals with a revolution, a rival manager, and a wise-cracking singer.
filmography.plot: A banana plantation owner tries to keep his top overseer from quitting while dealing with a revolutionary bandit and a visiting card sharp.

filmography.title: City for Conquest
filmography.role_description: A truck driver with musical ambitions who becomes a boxer to support his brother's education, only to be blinded in the ring.
filmography.plot: A truck driver turns to prizefighting to help his brother become a composer, but the sport takes a toll on his health and his relationship.

filmography.title: The Strawberry Blonde
filmography.role_description: A dentist in 1890s New York who reminisces about his youth, his rival, and the girl he thought he loved.
filmography.plot: A man feels he married the wrong girl and envies his old rival, but eventually realizes he is the lucky one.

filmography.title: The Bride Came C.O.D.
filmography.role_description: A pilot heavily in debt who agrees to kidnap an oil heiress to prevent her from eloping, leading to a screwball romance.
filmography.plot: A pilot agrees to help a father stop his daughter's wedding by kidnapping her, but they crash in the desert and fall in love.

filmography.title: Captains of the Clouds
filmography.role_description: A brash Canadian bush pilot who constantly clashes with authority but proves his worth when he joins the RCAF during WWII.
filmography.plot: A group of Canadian bush pilots join the Royal Canadian Air Force during World War II, but one has trouble following orders.

filmography.title: Yankee Doodle Dandy
filmography.role_description: The legendary song-and-dance man, playwright, and composer whose life story is told in this patriotic musical biography.
filmography.plot: A musical portrait of the life of the renowned composer, playwright, actor, dancer, and singer George M. Cohan.

filmography.title: 13 Rue Madeleine
filmography.role_description: An O.S.S. instructor who discovers a German double agent among his students and takes on a dangerous mission in occupied France.
filmography.plot: An American intelligence agent uncovers a German mole during training and later goes on a mission to France to feed him false information.

filmography.title: White Heat
filmography.role_description: A psychotic, mother-obsessed gang leader prone to debilitating headaches who meets a fiery end atop a gas storage tank.
filmography.plot: A psychopathic criminal with a mother complex makes a daring escape from prison and leads his old gang in a chemical plant payroll heist.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Motion Picture Story

filmography.title: Kiss Tomorrow Goodbye
filmography.role_description: A ruthless, intelligent career criminal who escapes from a prison farm and brutally manipulates everyone around him to build a crime empire.
filmography.plot: A violent criminal escapes from a prison farm and embarks on a crime spree involving corrupt cops and two women.

filmography.title: Mister Roberts
filmography.role_description: The petty, tyrannical captain of a Navy cargo ship who makes life miserable for his crew and clashes with his popular executive officer.
filmography.plot: In the waning days of World War II, a cargo ship officer battles his tyrannical captain while trying to get a transfer to combat duty.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor (Jack Lemmon)

filmography.title: Love Me or Leave Me
filmography.role_description: A menacing Chicago racketeer known as 'The Gimp' who manages the career of singer Ruth Etting while controlling her life.
filmography.plot: The true story of the rise of 1920s singer Ruth Etting and her turbulent marriage to a gangster who helped boost her career.

filmography.title: Tribute to a Bad Man
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, tough horse rancher in the West who dispenses his own harsh brand of justice to rustlers, alienating those close to him.
filmography.plot: A ruthless land baron in the Wyoming Territory clashes with a young easterner over his harsh treatment of rustlers and his relationship with a woman.

filmography.title: These Wilder Years
filmography.role_description: A wealthy businessman who returns to his hometown to find the illegitimate son he gave up for adoption years earlier.
filmography.plot: A wealthy businessman tries to find the illegitimate son he gave up for adoption twenty years ago, facing opposition from the orphanage director.

filmography.title: Man of a Thousand Faces
filmography.role_description: The silent film star known for his transformative makeup and roles, portrayed here in a biopic that explores his troubled personal life.
filmography.plot: A biopic of silent horror star Lon Chaney, detailing his rise to fame, his skill with makeup, and his family struggles.

filmography.title: Never Steal Anything Small
filmography.role_description: A charming but corrupt union leader who tries to win the union presidency and steal a lawyer's wife in this musical comedy.
filmography.plot: A crooked waterfront labor leader decides to run for union president, using every dirty trick in the book to win.

filmography.title: Shake Hands with the Devil
filmography.role_description: A college professor who is secretly a ruthless commander in the Irish Republican Army during the Irish War of Independence.
filmography.plot: An American student in 1921 Dublin gets drawn into the I.R.A. struggle against the British Black and Tans, led by his professor.

filmography.title: One, Two, Three
filmography.role_description: A high-energy Coca-Cola executive in West Berlin who must deal with his boss's daughter marrying a communist in this fast-paced satire.
filmography.plot: A Coca-Cola executive in West Berlin is given the task of taking care of his boss's socialite daughter, but things go wrong when she marries a communist.

filmography.title: Ragtime
filmography.role_description: The real-life New York City Police Commissioner, played with authority in his final feature film role.
filmography.plot: A young black pianist becomes embroiled in the lives of an upper-class white family in early 1900s New York City.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (Howard E. Rollins Jr.)
